#read data, 2019 Data seems legit
data = pd.read_csv(r'/kaggle/input/world-happiness/2019.csv')

source.69a27f9e:

RTD.fit(x_train, y_train)
y_pred = RTD.predict(x_test)
r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
source.262a27cc:

reg.fit(x_train,y_train)

source.dcf6c54b:
we havee a data set as 156 x 9. The "Overal Rank" feature is not neccessary so we will drop it. Similarly, Country region will be droped too.

Before the EDA it would be nice to clear that for the Prediction Method, output is the Score which is happiness score of the country. And the remainin 6 features are the input. It can be seen as all the inputs are numeric and output is numeric too. Hence, the problem will lead to regression task.
source.d1dce984: Everything seems fine, not to much correlation. Hence, multi-collinearity problem is seemly not exist.
source.cdbae7ed: There are 155 countries, so that adding it by one hot encoder is not a good idea. Maybe it can be applied as a column in other words single encoder. Im sure that country as a geography affects the happiness (i know, there are parameters in data frame gives the characteristics of the country but still there is sg called fate ^^) so that "for now" i will drop it, at the end we can check the country affect.
